derivation.yuyuan_name: Old English stēorbord 'rudder side' (see steer, board), because early Teutonic sailing vessels were steered with a paddle over the right side

entry.def: In sailing, the starboard side of a ship is the right side when you are on it and facing towards the front.

example.ex: He detected a ship moving down the starboard side of the submarine.
example.tran: 他发现有一艘船正在潜艇的右侧航行。

means.word_mean: 1. the right side of a ship or aircraft to someone facing the bow or nose
1. turn to the right, of helms or rudders
1. located on the right side of a ship or aircraft
